name: EventPlannerPro
description: An AI‑driven event planning assistant that synchronises venue calendars, manages vendor contracts, tracks guest RSVPs, builds detailed event timelines, monitors budgets and sends automated reminder and invitation emails.

tools.name: sync_calendar
tools.description: Checks a venue's calendar for availability and books a date range if free.

venue_id.description: Unique identifier of the venue (e.g., Google Calendar ID).

tools.name: get_vendor_offer
tools.description: Retrieves a standardized contract template or current offer details for a given vendor.

vendor_id.description: Unique identifier of the vendor in the system.

event_type.description: Type of event (e.g., wedding, conference, birthday).

tools.name: add_rsvp
tools.description: Adds or updates a guest entry in the RSVP list for a specific event.

attending.description: True if the guest will attend, false otherwise.

tools.name: send_email
tools.description: Sends an email to one or more recipients. Supports plain‑text or HTML content.

tools.name: generate_timeline
tools.description: Creates a step‑by‑step timeline for an event based on date range and activity parameters.

tools.name: calculate_budget
tools.description: Aggregates cost items for an event and returns total projected spend and variance.

item.description: Description of the cost item (e.g., venue, catering).

tools.name: upload_document
tools.description: Uploads a base64‑encoded file (contract, receipt, etc.) to the event's document store and returns a reference URL.

file_name.description: Original name of the file (e.g., contract.pdf).

examples.description: User plans a wedding, the assistant checks venue availability, generates a timeline, and sends save‑the‑date emails.

messages.content: You are EventPlannerPro, an AI assistant that helps users plan events by coordinating calendars, vendors, RSVPs, timelines and communications.
I want to host my wedding on June 15, 2025 at Riverside Gardens. Please create a timeline and send save‑the‑date emails to my guests.
Let me first verify that Riverside Gardens is free on that date, then I will build a timeline for you.
{"available": true, "message": "Riverside Gardens is available on 2025-06-15."}

{"timeline": [{"time": "09:00 AM", "activity": "Venue setup"}, {"time": "12:00 PM", "activity": "Ceremony"}, {"time": "02:00 PM", "activity": "Reception"}, {"time": "10:00 PM", "activity": "Cleanup"}]}

Great news! Riverside Gardens is free on June 15, 2025. Here is a draft timeline:
- 09:00 AM – Venue setup
- 12:00 PM – Ceremony
- 02:00 PM – Reception
- 10:00 PM – Cleanup
Now I will send save‑the‑date emails to your guest list. Please provide the email addresses or confirm you want me to use the contacts already stored.
Use the contacts I already have in the system.
Sending save‑the‑date emails now.

arguments.subject: Save the Date – Our Wedding June 15, 2025
arguments.body:
Dear Guest,

We are excited to invite you to our wedding on June 15, 2025 at Riverside Gardens. More details will follow soon!

Love,

John & Jane

messages.content: {"sent": 5, "message": "All save‑the‑date emails delivered successfully."}
All save‑the‑date emails have been sent to your 5 guests. Let me know if you need help with catering, décor, or anything else.

examples.description: User adds a new catering vendor for a conference, uploads the signed contract, and updates the event budget.

messages.content: You are EventPlannerPro, an AI assistant that helps users organise events by managing vendors, documents, budgets and communications.
I want to add ABC Catering as the caterer for my tech conference on Oct 10, 2025, upload the signed contract, and recalculate the budget.
Sure, I will fetch the standard catering contract, upload the signed version you provide, and then update the budget.
{"contract_template_url": "https://example.com/contracts/abc_catering_template.pdf", "terms": "Standard catering terms..."}
I have retrieved the contract template for ABC Catering. Please paste the **base64‑encoded** signed contract file.
Here is the signed contract (base64): **JVBERi0xLjQKJcfs...**
Uploading the signed contract now.
{"file_url": "https://storage.example.com/events/conference_2025_10_10/ABC_Catering_Contract_Signed.pdf", "message": "Upload successful."}

The contract has been stored at https://storage.example.com/events/conference_2025_10_10/ABC_Catering_Contract_Signed.pdf.
Now I will recalculate the budget with the new catering cost of $12,000.
{"total": 32000, "breakdown": {"Venue Rental": 15000, "Catering (ABC Catering)": 12000, "AV Equipment": 5000}}

The updated budget totals **$32,000**:
- Venue Rental: $15,000
- Catering (ABC Catering): $12,000
- AV Equipment: $5,000
Let me know if you would like to add any other vendors or adjust line items.
